Ibirapuera Park is an absolute gem, deserving every bit of its 5-star rating. The park's vast green spaces, picturesque lakes, and well-maintained trails make it a haven for nature lovers and those seeking a peaceful escape in the heart of S√£o Paulo.
During my visit around Christmas, I was treated to a mesmerizing water light show that added a magical touch to the park's ambiance. The synchronized lights dancing on the water created a festive atmosphere, making it a delightful experience for visitors of all ages.
One of the highlights for me was renting a tricycle to explore the park. Riding through the tree-lined pathways provided a unique and enjoyable perspective of the surroundings. It's a fantastic option for families or anyone looking to add a touch of whimsy to their park visit.
The park's infrastructure is commendable, with clean restroom facilities and well-marked trails. The variety of recreational areas, including playgrounds and sports courts, ensures there's something for everyone. I appreciated the effort put into maintaining the park's cleanliness, contributing to a pleasant and inviting environment.

reviews.Avaliacao: I recently visited Parque Villa-Lobos in S√£o Paulo on a rainy Sunday morning for my long run, and I must say, it exceeded all my expectations!
